channel.title: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features

item.title: NASA Superstars Recognized for Contributions to Aeronautics
item.description: NASA hosted an event in the 1990s to remind the public that the agency consists of a diverse group of talented people who are advancing aeronautics every day.
item.source: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features

item.title: NASA MIRO Program Provides STEM Career Path
item.description: Dionne Hernandez-Lugo always wanted to work for NASA, but did not know how to get started on her career path.
item.source: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features

item.title: NASA Launches Power to Explore Challenge for K-12 Students
item.description: NASA launches its second Power to Explore Challenge, a national competition for K-12 students that inspires learning about how radioisotope power systems help us explore the extremes of our solar system.
item.source: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features

item.title: NASA’s Solid-State Battery Research Exceeds Initial Goals, Draws Interest
item.description: NASA researchers are making progress with developing an innovative battery pack that is lighter, safer, and performs better than batteries commonly used in vehicles and large electronics today.
item.source: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features

item.title: Former Astronaut Haise Supported Early Microgravity Studies at Glenn
item.description: : Before becoming an Apollo astronaut, Fred Haise was a research pilot at NASA Glenn working on early research studies about how fluids behave in microgravity, which continues today.
item.source: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features

item.title: NASA Glenn Celebrates Newest Members of its Hall of Fame
item.description: NASA Glenn inducted 10 members into its Hall of Fame. This class was chosen in 2021, but due to the pandemic the ceremony was delayed until today.
item.source: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features

item.title: NASA Manages Astronaut Health with Effective Diagnostics Research
item.description: NASA is testing a suite of medical diagnostic devices aboard the International Space Station that will help astronauts evaluate their physical condition in space.
item.source: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features

item.title: NASA Wind Tunnel Facility Opens New Lobby for Guests
item.description: Guests visiting or coming to do research in the 10x10 supersonic wind tunnel facility at NASA’s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland will be welcomed inside a renovated lobby opened August 9.
item.source: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features

item.title: Glenn’s Legacy of Testing Spacecraft Spans from Apollo to Artemis
item.description: For 50 years, NASA’s Glenn Research Center has been testing spacecraft that launched to the Moon. That legacy continues with the upcoming launch of Artemis.
item.source: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features

item.title: The Road to the Moon Goes Through Ohio
item.description: Follow this infographic to learn how scientists and engineers both at NASA Glenn Research Center and scores of Ohio companies have advanced power and propulsion systems, spacecraft testing and studies to keep astronauts healthy and safe.
item.source: NASA Glenn Research Center Latest Features
